cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue west-northwest along the north coast of Cuba, then turn northwest toward the Florida Keys and up the Florida peninsula, passing very near the west-central coast including Tampa Bay.

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to Anclote River (includes Tampa Bay region)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning: Sebastian Inlet southward around FL peninsula to Venice; Hurricane Warning: Jupiter Inlet southward around FL peninsula to Bonita Beach and the Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially the west coast from the Keys northward past Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are very likely (82%); hurricane-force winds possible (33% chance for 64-kt winds) with peak gusts potentially exceeding 90 mph if the core tracks near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–6 ft of surge possible in and around Tampa Bay, higher if the center tracks just south of the port and onshore winds persist.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches likely with isolated amounts up to 12 inches, producing flash-flood potential and ponding in port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and dangerous waves in Tampa Bay and approaches, coastal flooding, hazardous surf and rip currents, possible tornadoes in outer rainbands.
